name: DaVinci Hotel and Suites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is a 5 star hotel with many ammenaties. It is located in Nelson Mandela Square which is the new part of Johanneburg. It has indoor shops with over 200, and resturants to die for. The atmosphere was excellent and the food wonderful. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone that is going to South Africa. It could not be nicer and the people very friendly.
reviews.title: vacation

reviews.text: Hotel is in good condition, but I have to say the black and white themed decor isn't really to my taste. Feels a bit dated.
reviews.title: Pretty good hotel, but poor gym and a bit inflexible

reviews.text: Nice bar area and pool deck, where service was good. Breakfast was in a separate restaurant area downstairs in the mall in which the hotel is located. Slightly odd, but great buffet and good service.
reviews.title: Overrated

reviews.text: Room was nice and spacious with well equipped bathroom. I was in a corner room with a good little sitting area. Great free wifi too.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel Experience

reviews.text: Gym is very disappointing with only 5 pieces of cardio equipment all of which are basic and old. The weights area looked pretty good though.
reviews.title: Great Service and very spacious and well designed rooms!

reviews.text: This was my second stay at The Davinci and cannot fault a thing during my stay.The staff was pleaseant and friendly, Management very visible and the restaurant including room service asolutely marvelous.Love the cigar lounge and very friendly lady working in the Art Gallery next door , , she seems so part of the Hotel.Well done and see you again soon.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.text: Spent 2 nights and received a warm welcome with efficient valet parking. I enjoyed a very smooth, quick check in, internet access code was offered and received a slick orientation of my room.
reviews.title: Fresh, modern and VERY well run- possibly the best hotel in sandton

reviews.text: The mini bar isn't stocked but there is a message inside saying to contact room service if required. Complimentary tea, coffee, water etc is provided. In addition, the restaurants forming part of the hotel have extensive wine and drinks menus, all of which are available. I requested ice and this was brought up very quickly.
reviews.title: Good central hotel

reviews.text: My room overlooked the pool area rather than the other side of a building which overlooked the road, which I had expected, this was actually much better. I had requested a smoking room and was asked to smoke on the balcony rather than in the room. This is much more preferable for me as even as a smoker I hate a musty room smelling of smoke.
reviews.title: Convenient and quality

reviews.text: The room has a large balcony that is accessed by several rooms. Unusual and I was concerned about disturbing my neighbors when I had visitors, and less privacy should another guest be using it as well. But there were tables and view over the pool area was nice. On the whole I would get the same room again. The large balcony added to the sense of space, which was already spacious for a "standard grade" room.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately we were only able to stay here for one night. The staff was so accommodating and kind. The hotel is beautiful and has an amazing location. It is located on the Nelson Mandela Square just steps from the mall and great restaurants. If you are in this area, this is definitely a place to stay.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel and Staff

reviews.text: Friendly and attentive staff, clean, modern, different/creative interior, fast internet (for South African standards anyway), comfortable bed, good quality linen, good breakfast with plenty of choice (and a breakfast on the go for those who don't have time for a sit-down breakfast!), lovely touches (e.g. a Lindt chocolate on your bed every night), very conveniently located with direct access to Sandton Mall with all its shops, restaurants etc..
reviews.title: Modern, sexy, wow
Very nice modern hotel
reviews.text: Unfortunately, I did not have time to visit the spa, maybe next time...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can highly recommend this hotel and would love to return some time.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel
Very nice hotel with intermittent internet
reviews.text: Stayed here for a day. Very nice modern hotel in th heart of Sandton City. Convenient for shopaholics. Its a good hotel but they to work on a number of issues. Check in was fast although I requested a room away from noise and I was given room 607 one of the noisiest room as it faces th bar area wh8ch played music till 8pm. But after 8 it was quiet. Th linen and bathroom was very clean but th carpet was the dirtiest i have seen in a long time. Th phone was not working so I had to use my mobile phone to call receiption to for in house requests. I reported th problem at 5pm and th person who came to fix failed to resolve the problem. By th time I left at 12pm it hadn't been fixed. requests.

I ended up staying at the DaVinci because the Michelangelo Hotel where I was attending a conference was already full. In my opinion, the DaVinci had a better breakfast and WAY cooler style. I had to walk a short 5-10 min walk through the mall to get over to the other property and the convention center is also attached to the mall so it was really a great location for all my meetings. The service was great and the rooms were clean and well appointed. Only thing that is a little weird is the internet has a max on how much data you can use. This seems to be a weird policy for a business hotel and I had the same problem staying at a sister property elsewhere in South Africa. They need to get with the times and just give guests the internet access they expect without jumping through hoops.
reviews.title: Swanky boutique hotel choice close to convention center

reviews.text: Best hotel in Santon. All expectations were exceeded.
reviews.title: Exceeds all expectations

reviews.text: The room is fantastic with a great view and the staff were great.
reviews.title: Fabulous

reviews.text: What I liked most was their food. I totally enjoyed the dinner I had@ the restaurant n also the breakfast selection was magnificent.
reviews.title: "Dash of speed....."

reviews.text: I stayed here as part of a group booking so I am not sure what the rate is. Fabulous hotel gorgeous rooms comfy beds wonderful sheets and pillows. Was just a bit of hall noise would be the only downside rooms aren't super soundproof.
reviews.title: Amazing x 100

description: DAVINCI Hotel and Suites - A Contemporary Masterpiece. Legacy’s latest luxury hotel and all suites development is located adjacent to the prime location of Nelson Mandela Square. This is Legacy’s fourth hotel on the cosmopolitan square in the heart of the Sandton business and leisure district. One could speak of the opulence of the rooms, the restaurant and lounge, pioneering fitness centre and health spa but we suggest you come and see for yourself. Guests can enjoy the convenience of luxurious shopping at the Legacy Corner Mall and Sandton City just an elevator trip away.
